results.title: Handicrafts of India (Travancore)
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Leaves of tress, buffalo horns and multi-colored sand and shells from the beach at Cape Comorin are some of the simple materials which the gifted craftsmen of Travancore deftly turn into beautiful and fascinating handicrafts. The film also shows lace manufacture depicting the work of the men, women and children of Travancore.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A. Bhaskar Rao, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Handicrafts of Japan
results.creator_credit: Dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A survey of the traditional handicrafts of Japan. Crafts shown in some detail are the hand painting of costumes and features; spinning and dyeing of thread for home weaving; the making of bamboo baskets, paper lanterns and decorated paper fans. Examples of clay pottery of all shapes, sizes and design with intricate and skilful glazing and decoration is also presented.

results.title: A Handful of soil
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Mollot and Sam Orleans and Associates
results.brief_description: Research in the development of antibiotics, particularly that of Dr Selman Waksman; also cooperation of scientists and pharmaceutical companies in the mass prodution of antibiotics. From penicillin to streptomycin and beyond.

results.title: Handel and his music
results.brief_description: Presents the life story and musical works of George Frideric Handel. Explores the social and political conditions of the period. Explains the musical forms used and developed by Handel - the oratorio, masque opera, suite and baroque. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: Julius Caesar; Water Music; Concerto Grosso No. 6; Italian Cantata No. 17; Messiah - “I know that my redeemer liveth” and ” Hallelujah chorus”.

results.title: Hand sawing
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of handling hand saws and choosing the right saw for the job. Outlines the manufacture of saws from primitive times to those made with high-grade ateel today.

results.title: Hand of Adam
results.creator_credit: Murray Grigor, Films of Scotland and Viz Ltd
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Robert Adam, the Scottish architect of the 18th century. His designs were mostly inspired by Ancient Rome and Greece, having studied these styles in Italy. Many examples of his fine work are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Grigor, Films of Scotland and Viz Ltd

results.title: Hamster from Hamsterdam
results.creator_credit: W. Reiner, Z Drakulic and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An animated film using three-dimensional objects for the characters. A song tells the story of the hamster searching for a pair of gloves to keep his hands warm. Designed to encourage story telling and rhyme making by children.

results.title: Hamlet studies in interpretation
results.creator_credit: Richard Callanan and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This film shows two scenes from Hamlet, the Ophelia-Hamlet scene and the closet scene. The film demonstrates how different interpretation of the scenes by directors and actors may alter the impressions conveyed to the audience. Scenes are performed by Elizabeth Spriggs and Tom Chadbon.
results.description: This film shows two scenes from Hamlet, the Ophelia-Hamlet scene and the closet scene. results.title: Hamlet (Olivier)
results.brief_description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

results.description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action. Technically the film makes use of a number of camera devices, particularly the travelling camera. The characterization does not depart from the traditional.
description_for_label: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action. results.title: Hamersley 70
results.brief_description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.
results.description: A Survey of the Hamersley Range iron mining operations. Includes scenes of the excavation of the ore from Mount Tom Price, the 182 mile railway to Dampier - the port from which iron pellets are exported all over the world.
